In mobile, extra taps and clicks are not evil. As long as each tap or click answers a Q or completes a task, user is happy. #aeasd
Progressive disclosure lets us uncomplicate complexity and speed the interface. #design #design4touch @bigmediumjosh #aeasd
We want to eliminate complication, not complexity. Complexity is good—it's how we solve complex problems. @bigmediumjosh #aeasd #design
As screens got bigger, we filled them with crap. Start w mobile first to make better decisions about what to include. #aeasd #design4touch
44px touch targets require at least 2mm of gutter between them. (Or make targets bigger than 44px if no gutter.) #design4touch #aeasd
Mobile grid is built in multiples of finger size (44px). It's a design that's not only FOR the hand, but OF the hand. @bigmediumjosh #aeasd
Control size hit points in mobile: 7mm does the job; bump to 9mm for important buttons & #a11y. #design4touch #mobile @bigmediumjosh #aeasd
Content on top, controls on the bottom. Best for hand ergonomics, best for putting content first. #design #mobile #aeasd @bigmediumjosh
Nobody came to your fancy site for its controls. They’re there for your content. Lead with content, push controls to bottom. #mobile #aeasd
